name: International Dockworkers Council
goal: The International Dockworkers Council (IDC) is an international nonprofit association formed by 93 organizations from 42 countries, with over 125,000 affiliated members. Our mission is to uphold labor standards that will improve the economic and social well-being of port workers around the world. IDC serves as an interlocutor to form fair and sustainable policies, and to promote best practices across the maritime industry.
interests: Competition, Economy, finance and the euro, Employment and Social Affairs, International co-operation and development, Trans-European Networks, Transport
euInitiatives: IDC is the only organisation capable of bringing together the different port dockworker groups and unions with a single voice on an regional (EU) and international scale.  Dockworkers can discuss regional issues and initiatives (ex. new legislation in Ports)  with the EU in an effort to both form new ideas through constructive dialogue and as an interlocutor between national governments and international decision-making forums.
